program_name: Load Management Standard Offer Pathway (Load Management Pathway - LMP)

data_sources.data_quality_notes: Verified from official SWEPCO program website

capacity_rate.notes: Monetary incentives paid for interrupting electrical load. Rate is $30/kW of estimated savings.

performance_rate.notes: No separate performance payment. Incentive is based on verified peak demand (kW) savings during interruption events.

call_windows.notes: Weekdays only, excluding holidays. Summer period: June 1 - September 30
Weekdays only, excluding holidays. Winter period: December 1 - March 31

additional_requirements: Must have interval data recorder (IDR) or AMI metering
Cannot be on a tariff-based demand response rate
Must have ability to interrupt at least 50 kW of electric load
Located on SWEPCO's Arkansas distribution system

event_parameters.max_events_per_year: not specified (3 per month limit applies)
event_parameters.event_day_constraints: Weekdays only, excluding holidays, no more than 3 consecutive days

notification.notes: One-hour advance notice for load interruption

event_triggers.trigger_description: SWEPCO's Load Management Standard Offer Pathway provides incentives to large commercial customers for load curtailment on short notice during peak demand periods. Events are called by utility based on system needs.

nomination_bidding.nomination_details: Customers choose summer, winter, or both periods. Two-hour or four-hour interruption options available.

penalties.notes: Incentives are based on verified peak demand savings, suggesting measurement and verification but no explicit penalty structure documented.

historical_events.notes: Historical event data not publicly available

integration_metadata.data_access_notes: UtilityAPI provides automated bill and usage data downloads from SWEPCO but no documented DR program enrollment API
integration_metadata.notes: Comprehensive information from official SWEPCO program website. Payment rates, eligibility, and event parameters well documented. Limited information on penalties, baseline methodology, and historical performance.
integration_metadata.research_notes: Attempted to locate Arkansas Public Service Commission tariff filings and annual energy efficiency reports but PDF documents were not readable through automated extraction. Direct program website provided most reliable information.
